{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Mist Systems |model=AP41 |series=AC2600 |asin=B075K382KW,B075MYMG4W;CA; |fcc_date=02/24/2016 |manuf_country=Taiwan |is_manuf=No |manuf=Wistron NeWeb |type=enterprise access point |fcc_id=2AHBN-AP41 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=3 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_poe=at |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM58625 |cpu1_cspeed=1.2 GHz |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=256 |fla1_brand=Micron |fla1_model=MT29F2G08ABAFA |ram1=512 |ram1_brand=SK hynix |ram1_model=H5TQ2G63GFR |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe, USB 2.0 |expansion_minipcie_num=2 |expansion_usb_num=1 |wi1_module=Wistron NeWeb DNXB-30 |wi1_module_if=Mini PCIe (oversized) |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM43465 |wi1_chip2_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip2_model=BCM43465 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=4 |wi1_rxchains=4 |wi1_sstreams=4 |wi2_module=Wistron NeWeb DNXB-31 |wi2_module_if=Mini PCIe |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM43162 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=1 |wi2_rxchains=1 |wi2_sstreams=1 |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=3 |addl_chips=2.5/5GHz Dual-Band 802.11ac Wireless LAN Front-End Module (FEM);Skyworks;SKY85806-11;;1; ,,, Single-Chip Bluetooth 4.1 LE Transceiver/Baseband Processor (BBP);Broadcom (Cypress);BCM20704;;1; |flags=Wave2, MU-MIMO, Bluetooth 4.1 LE, DFS (master), |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |oui=5C:5B:35 |oui_eth=5C:5B:35 }}
:• '''1733''' Mbps - 4SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ac#Data_rates_and_speed 802.11ac] (80MHz chan.), :• '''800''' Mbps - 4SS 2.4GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11n-2009#Data_rates 802.11n] (40MHz chan., 256QAM) = '''''2600 Mbps'' class'''
{{TagLine|Premium Performance Gigabit Wi-Fi Wave 2 Access Point}} :[https://www.mist.com/products/ Product page] {{•}} [https://www.mist.com/wp-content/uploads/Mist-AP41-Datasheet.pdf Datasheet] The datasheet seems to claim 802.11ac support at 2.4GHz with proprietary clients saying, "2.4GHz: :4x4:4 802.11b/g/n/ac up to 800 Mbps data rate. 802.11ac for VHT capable Proprietary clients." Mist calls this a tri-radio device which refers to the fact that it has three radios. The third radio is used :for "2.4 GHz & 5 GHz dual-band WIDS/WIPS, spectrum analysis & location analytics," not for clients. This scanning radio uses a [[Broadcom]] BCM43465 and a [[Skyworks]] SKY85806-11 front-end module. :8-pin [[IoT]] terminal block. ===Reviews=== *[https://blog.ianbeyer.com/2018/05/08/mist-deployment-part-the-first/ ''Mist Deployment (Part The First)'' on '''The CaNerdIan'''] ===Models=== :[http://www.ajpsolutions.co.uk/products/mist-systems/ Mist Systems Products] • FCC ID - [https://fccid.io/2AHBN 2AHBN] ''(Juniper Networks, Inc.)'' :;Wi-Fi 5 (802.11ac) *[[Mist Systems AP21]] • Wi-Fi & BLE Array AP :FCC ID: 2AHBN-AP21 (2018-07-30) *[[Mist Systems AP41]] • Premium Wi-Fi & BLE Array AP :FCC ID: 2AHBN-AP41 (2019-09-05) *[[Mist Systems AP61]] • Premium Outdoor Wi-Fi & BLE Array AP :FCC ID: 2AHBN-AP61 (2018-07-27) :;Wi-Fi 6 (802.11ax) *[[Mist Systems AP12]] • 802.11ax Wall-Plate AP :FCC ID: 2AHBN-AP12 (2020-10-20) *[[Mist Systems AP33]] • Wi-Fi & BLE Array AP :FCC ID: 2AHBN-AP33 (2020-07-22) *[[Mist Systems AP43]] • Premium 802.11ax WiFi and BLE AP :FCC ID: 2AHBN-AP43 (2020-05-06) *[[Mist Systems AP63]] • Premium Outdoor 802.11ax WiFi and BLE Array AP :FCC ID: 2AHBN-AP63 (2020-08-24) :;Bluetooth *[[Mist Systems BT11]] • BLE Array AP - Internal Antenna :FCC ID: 2AHBN-BT11 (2016-07-06) __NOTOC__
